review: 3.5. It is a reliable chain restaurant with huge portions and too many screaming kids. That said, I have my favorites. Split Pea Barley Soup. Hummus & pita appetizer. Tostada pizza with gobs of Cholula. Moroccan Chicken salad. That said, this branch often gets "special" orders wrong due to their formulaic preparation of most things. Good for a night out with the kids..

Given the smaller size of this location, I prefer not to be seated in any of those tables toward the back of the room (by the restrooms); I feel like I'm missing out back there. The Small Plates are simply too small. The "half-price wines" (as they're described) are rather misleading; for half price, one gets a half (of a small) glass (3 oz., according to their description). 3 oz?! I call that a "taste"!  I seem to always stick to my favorites: SALADS:   Original Chopped, Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad, and Roasted Vegetable (however, they've been inconsistent with the latter) PASTAS:  Kung Pao Spaghetti and the Asparagus and Spinach Spaghettini PIZZAS:  BLT pizza DESSERT:  Chocolate Souffle Cake! My favorite dishes aren't always consistent in taste; the service, for the most part, is pleasant; and the location is convenient. CPK is one of our go-to places.
Love love the avocado egg rolls and the California club pizza are good problem is that it's always full!!!!

Am I in a restaurant, or a nursing home? Holy cow, I know this isn't as popular as it used to be, but I felt like I was eating at Sizzler during the early bird special. I felt embarrassed ordering multiple alcoholic beverages, like someone was going to tell me to 'keep it down, Sonny!' I really hate their pizza. Why the hell would you take a perfectly normal pizza and dump a completely unrelated dish on top of it, like a salad? I think if you look at their menu you'd find pork lo mein pizza, BBQ rack of rib pizza, fondue pizza, fish and chips pizza, strawberry yogurt pizza, need I go on? Yuck! Had a couple of their small cravings (appetizers) which were pretty good. Also very cheap. I had the mac & cheese bites, quesadillas and korean tacos. All were pretty good, and pretty cheap. Tiny portions, but I like that, especially if priced correctly. I had the tequila chicken alfredo pasta. It was good, but a little on the bland side. My wife had the carnitas pizza. It was good, but again, putting all that weird crap on a pizza isn't my idea of anything more than a novelty. At least everything was priced reasonable. I think even the pizza was under $10. We even got a decent bottle of wine for $20. The bartender was heavy handed with the jack on my jack and coke, as well. Big points for that. All in all, it's kind of hard to enjoy much of anything in a restaurant that's really not much nicer than Denny's decor. The yellow color inside is closer to orange, which really makes it feel even older.  IF I came back here I would have to sit at the bar. The bar seems a little less like a family dining area and a little more casual and modern. Unfortunately, the night we were there, the bar was packed and the tables, all empty. I'd return, but I'm not particularly excited about it. Their other locations have a little more life in them than this one.

3-1/2 stars. I haven't been here in ages since nothing on their menu really grabbed my attention, even during their popular days back in the 90s.  So why did I even bother to come here?  Well, a coupon (that my sister had), of course. We came here for lunch right when it opened at 11:00a on a Friday.  My kids ordered the curly mac 'n' cheese that came with a beverage with free refills ($5.50), and my sister and I shared the full size roasted vegetable salad ($13.25) and the roasted garlic chicken pizza ($12.25).  I usually try not to order anything garlicky during the day, but I couldn't find a pizza that I really wanted to try.  Besides, I wasn't planning on seeing any friends later, so it was all good. The pizza was good, the salad was okay.  My kids' mac 'n' cheese was bland (which was probably better for them).  All in all, everything was okay, yet still on the pricey side, just like I remembered from when I ate here years and years ago (yay for coupon), but I gave them an extra 1/2 star for their friendly service.

My wife and I visited CPK last night. I had the Sicilian pizza, delicous as always and my wife had the Spaghetti Bolognese. My wifes dish the pasta was overcooked and it barly had enough sauce on it. She had to ask for more sauce. Madison who was are waiter was awesome and it is always a pleasure to be waited on by someone who is excited about there job and very outgoing.
I go here because it is pretty close to my house. We always crave the salads here, but I gotta say the service is mediocre.

In general, I love CPK for their consistency and the food never seems to dissapoint. Very reliable, fresh, and the variety suits my needs. The only "gripe" I have is a result of what I like..they're consistent but also very rigid in how they prepare/view a variation to a meal. While their food is very fresh, it is also measured to the ounce and in small baggies to ensure that all portions are the same. Big deal? Nah...but my wife has a challenging diet and removes a ton of things from her favorite salads and I mentioned to the server (who was a bit arrogant) that it'd be nice if she could have a bit more of what she did retain on the salad....well, they didn't and she received the salad sans all the things she can't eat with the typical 1 ounce baggie portion of what she could eat....all for the same price. So if a salad has a 7 baggie combo and you eliminate 5 of those baggies...could you maybe get an extra baggie or two fo the two you're keeping?? I mean if they're just vegetables and no hard cost...would it kill you or does the binder you're "chef's" read keep it so strict that you can't physically pull one more ounce out of the pre-made bin? I made another comment to the server that "could she get a few more beans?" in her salad and he smiled, walked away...never to return again but towards the end for any desert requests. I wonder sometimes...for a $11 salad is this place becoming "Cheap PK"?

Decent location. Had one of those scratchcard discounts that required manager approval. Took the manager nearly 15 minutes to get to our table. We watched him fiddle with the window shades, greet customers, etc before coming over. Pretty disappointing. I've done take out  as well as dined here. Typical CPK. There's a discount for lunch on the Tustin Marketplace website.

For what we paid and what we got - won't be back again.  Salmon tasted like it was cooked that morning and reheated then slapped on the made-to-look-like-it-was-on-the-grill cedar plank.  can you say rip-off?  wait staff were more interested in talking to each other than approaching our table. And out ticket was $125.  Good luck.

I'm not really a fan of it and I'm not really just a-ok with it either... so I guess I'm an ok-fan of them? Pizza = not so great = best is BBQ chicken & nothing else (3 stars) Pasta = not so great = best is Kung Pao spaghetti (4 stars)    Salad = nothing is great except Waldrof Chicken Salad = DO NOT let them load the dressing on (5 stars) Dessert = Strawberry Shortcake is the BOMB, but it's only seasonal (4 stars) Service = slow and mean attitude! (0 stars) Bottom line~ come here once in a while when I got nothing else in my head that I wanna eat or try

I'm a fan of CPK and of pizza in general so this review isn't about the Chain, but this restaurant in particular.  I've been to this location twice now and the food is excellent for being Hybrid Pizza.  No quarms there. I however have had two out of two experiences where the service left something to be desired. The staff just seems slow and uncaring to my and the tables needs. I'm a big guy so I tend to drink a lot of beverages and I got 1 (one) refill both times I was there.  If this was the sole incident I would have let it pass.  But lack of silverware for the salad or one of our members to a missed request to bring some dipping sauce that we had to ask another waiter because ours was no where in sight.  All in all, good food, bad service and I hope they get their act together.  I'm tired of meeting friends all the way across Irvine to the Michaelson branch just to enjoy CPK

This location is going down hill for some reason.  The last two meals we had here were bad, service is weak, and the music is highly annoying (repetitive techno?).  The menu appears to be shrinking as well.
They are great dealing with food allergies, and large groups with lots of children!

First time at CPK and I was unimpressed.  While their pizza was pretty decent (while terribly greasy.. even w/o meat) their service was absolutely horrible. The hostess was not at the stand at the time when we arrived, and failed to present us with the slightest smile nor friendliness. There were plenty of tables available but hardly any place to wait. We sat down after waiting for about 10 minutes and were greeted by a less than stoked server. We enjoyed their tuscan hummus as a starter. The Tuscan Hummus was creamier than their grecian counterparts as I believe this was made with a starchier white bean as opposed to the usual chickpeas. (loads more oil as well) Try it with their whole wheat pita, its a chewy delight!  We also ordered their crispy thin margarita pizza which was ridiculously oily, and soft. The pizza wasn't erect, it was more.. floppy.. Which was okay.. Probably laden with grease. If you order a pizza, you're guaranteed to be stuffed to the brim, I advise that you share it! Overall, the food was OKAY but the service was bad. Our server was not friendly, she did not refill our drinks a single time, and only checked up on us once. She was quick to give us the bill & I usually wouldn't mind... but the table next to us had the same server and she was all bees knees over them. Nevertheless, I don't think you're missing out if you skip out on this place.

Well, a little disappointed on my visit.  Food was pretty good, service was mediocre.   We stopped in on New Year's Day at 4:45pm.  The place was empty so we got seated right away.  We ordered peach iced tea which was terrible.  I believe they just pump peach syrup in regular iced tea, but we must have gotten a teaspoon of peach in there.   Our waiter was hardly visible which wouldn't normally bother me so long as he's taking care of our table.  Unfortunately, our drinks took a while; bread and butter took even longer.  Our table had dirty glasses and dishes scattered during our entire visit.   Regardless, the food was good and tasted fresh.  We ordered two salads and a pizza.  We got "half-salads" which were very large followed by a traditional pepperoni pizza on wheat dough.   I would probably return for the food but the level of service has some room to grow.

Who knew there was a CPK at the Marketplace.... This location is very small and hard to find. I never really cared for CPK before because I thought the menu was quite unimpressive. Also, they serve cold bread. Which I don't understand. However, I've finally found a good dish!! My favorite is the Habanero Carnitas pizza. The Habanero salsa comes on the side so you can spare it if you can't take the heat. It is quite spicy even for me, but it is really good!  Everything else, meh. Also, apparently you have to ask for bread now.
It was ok. Nothing much to write home about. The servers are nice, efficient and helpful. Food is just ok.

Had Chinease chix Salad and a BBQ chix pizza and a bottle of wine it wasgood but not great   Service - seated right away - but the waitress seemed to be busy and passed us up a few times  then finally got us a bottle of wine , once she  recognized we where there service got better. Food - Basic . but good - They could spice it a little more both the salad and the pizza where a bit bland. Value - not a bad value for what you get - its enough food and not to much. portion was fair. would i go back  - sure  why not its pretty good for a chain, clean and quality is good

Still a fan of this CPK location in the Tustin Marketplace. New observations: *Sticky menus -- yuck *Consistently cleaned bathrooms - a big pro *I like their "small bites" menu -- the asparagus arugula salad (with no parmasean) was really fresh and lightly dressed (the way I like it) and the white corn avocado salsa + corn tortilla chips were juuuust seasoned enough and not too salty! I love these little small bites options on menus so I can get a little more variety without sacrificing health.

The fire-oven-baked crust (good balance between soft and crisp) and the flavors of the toppings are why this place always stands out. BBQ chicken is the original and best. The Thai chicken is flavorful, nutty and sweet. The Santa Fe chicken is modestly spicy with fresh pico de gallo. And last time, I tried the chicken Waldorf salad (dressings on the side). Ask for lemon vinaigrette - creamy and tangy. Service was helpful, refilling the drinks and knowledgeable about the salad (so I'd know what to order if I wanted it again). Always a good pick when don't know where else to go.
Usually had good experiences at cpk, tonight got seated, no waitress, no water, nothing for 20 minutes, so we left. There are problems here.  I'm not coming back to this location, as in ever.

Let me start by saying that we love CPK and always look forward to eating here.  This is the first time I have been to the Tustin location (we usually go to the Irvine location), and I can say with complete certainty that we will never go back to this CPK.  The sevice was lousy- it took 10 minutes for a server to even look at us, the tables were dirty and the entire restaurant was in a chaotic state of disarray.  The food took forever, and when the starters finally came, they delivered the main course two minutes later, so we had no time to enjoy the starters.  To top it off, our  pizza was cold and the thin crust was soggy!   The server never came by and cleared any dishes, and she never offered to refill our drinks.  We will go back to the Irvine CPK, but never again will we subject ourselves to this poorly managed location.

Love this CPK!  My wife and I always go here!  We usually sit at the counter and enjoy some tasty margaritas!   We always get great service from Scott the bartender, if you can sit at the counter when he's working you will appreciate his service!
One of the better CPKs I've been to. Been here a few times and service ranges between average and great. Waits can get long during peak hours.

I have been going here for years and never been disappointed, just good quality pizza. I tried two items that are featured and have comments about them: 1) Spring Market vegetable salad: Maybe it was the Kale or lack of dressing but I felt like I was eating wet grass. I asked for a side order of the greek based dressing which improved it. Granted, if you want a really healthy salad go for this.  2) Korean Pizza with slowly cooked roasted pork and a kimchi salad on top. Very average, very little meat on the pizza, slight spicy kick once or twice, oversalty and the kimchi name should be removed because it doesn't do justice to Kimchi. This was tasteless cabbage at best. Also, there was cilantro in the Kimchi for some reason, authentic Kimchi doesn't have that.  I will return but won't order these items again.

I just tried their hot pepper dish, this was a stuffed bell pepper. This is a great snack on the go. Its light and tasty. I had stuffed myself with the appetizers and their raspberry drink. I also had some slices of the barbecue pizza. This is a awesome restaurant, had a great time.

I've got nothing against CPK but this location just didn't do it for me.  We came in here on a Sunday and beat the lunch and dinner rush because we were here at an odd hour - around 4:30ish so there really isn't an excuse for bad service since the place wasn't exactly busy.  We got seated quickly and that was about the only part that I liked. The server awkwardly greeted us, avoided eye contact, and I could tell it probably wasn't going to be a good dining experience and I was partially right. The bread and appetizers were good. It's hard to screw up bread and the avocado egg rolls. The pizza was a poor choice. I can't remember a single instance of liking Thai pizza but the boy wanted it vs what I was picking so the boy wins this round.  We had a gift card and gave her about $50 and asked for change which she managed to screw up. *sigh* Once again, it's not really all that busy. So how could you screw that up too?? This probably won't be a location I'll be returning to anytime soon.

Great food, warm environment, and friendly staff.  You can't go wrong with the BBQ chicken pizza.  CPK is famous for it.  That and a glass of Blue Moon beer really makes the meal perfect.  Kind of wished that the server's station was not near tables and instead at the bar.  I would hear the servers cussing over tips or complaining about other customers.

It's our second time at this location but maybe the 5th time at this chain,  Good Food, Good atmosphere, friendly staff, not expensive  we tried the Tostada, I was impressed, something different  you can split your pizza into two different halfs for some added dollar or two half BBQ chicken, half california veggie...not bad also the tuscan hummus was good choice for an appetizer server Jennifer was nice and attentive, I'll definitely come back

It has been years since I have been to this CPK.  I sort of remembered where in the general area of the Tustin Market Ranch it was, but I still got a bit lost.  I was trying to find Red Robin, because if I saw that, I knew I was close.  Thing is, the Red Robin no longer exists there. ha ha Man, the Tustin Market Place parking is crazy. But we find a spot and head inside.  Although it was just the beginning of lunch time (12:30 p.m.), it wasn't too bad as we were seated right away. Our server comes over and asks what we would like to drink,  I mention Mountain Dew. And she's like "Sorry, we don't have Mountain Dew". I mentioned if she had Sierra Mist. She's like "Sorry, we don't have Sierra Mist. We have Sprite". When I heard Sprite, I thought to myself  "#$^@& Coke products". If there was a camera on me, it would have done the three-framed close up with the dum-dum-duuummm music que.  The server says "We don't carry Pepsi products anymore. It's all Coke products.  We switched out last week.  I just lowered my head in shame as I asked for a Sprite.  I should have just gotten water.  I ordered my traditional cheese and my friend ordered Moroccan Spiced Chicken Salad.  My pizza was really good, as it always is at any CPK.  The Moroccan Spiced Chicken salad that my friend ordered ended up being a bit sweet for him and so he didn't finish it. The service was great and the staff friendly.  The place looked well clean.

We have always been a fan of CPK and this is our first time visiting the one in The Market Place in Tustin.  This review is for THIS particular location only. THAI CRUNCH SALAD:  A very nice blend of napa cabbage, cilantro, and other greens mixed with nuts and rice sticks and tossed in a very tasty Thai peanut dressing.  The dressing was rich but it didn't overwhelm the freshness of the salad.  It is a crunchy kind of salad, so if that's what you crave, you'll love it. Hot! WILD MUSHROOM PIZZA:  Amazing!  It was topped with an exotic mix of mushrooms such as Shitake and Portobello, and the pizza had a very rich mushroom aroma which was every mushroom lover's dream.  This is how you differentiate a good pizza from a great one - the aroma.  You can smell the flavor of the ingredients.  Hot! SERVICE:  Our server has been excellent throughout.  He has been attentive, courteous and helpful.  Our iced tea and water was never empty.  When we told him that we were sharing the salad and the pizza, he gave us a choice of serving us the salad first and then the pizza, or serving both items at the same time.  We opted to have the salad first and then the pizza.  Awesome! So, now you ask, what is the difference between 3 stars and 4 stars?  The answer:  How a restaurant is willing to accommodate special requests from a customer. We requested the Thai crunch salad without cilantro and the server said all the salads are pre-mixed and that cannot be done.  And he was really apologetic about it.  Note:  This is NOT the server's fault.  There is nothing that he can do about it.  It is the restaurant's policy or the setup of the kitchen that they cannot accommodate such a simple request.  We have been to a CPK in the San Diego area, ordered the exact same salad with the special request of no cilantro and there was no problem.  I guess the kitchen there was willing to make a separate batch of salad for us. And that is precisely the difference between a 3-star restaurant and a 4-star restaurant.  A 4-star restaurant would have happily and easily accommodated such a simple request.  A 3-star restaurant is either unwilling or unable to do so.

CPK changed their menu a short while ago. No big difference. But the staff here is poorly trained. This is our neighborhood CPK. Our kids love pizzas. But this is the fourth time in a row that we've experience very slow service.  There are more servers than customers so they wander around chit chatting with each other. Not too efficient a crew and poorly trained. Not much leadership here from the managing staff either. As I write this review I see more flirting amongst the staff than good service.  This restaurant used to be packed.  It's 12:15 pm now on a Saturday and 60% of the restaurant is empty...the lady sitting next to me waited for about 10 mins now and they just took her order.  Food is okay, but don't expect anything more than two star service!

Definitely a more enjoyable visit. Alyssa is such a sweetheart and we're glad we came back. I seem to see a lot more smiling workers and the "CPI Tustin salutes you, our heroes" hits home as my soon to be husband has been serving 12 years with more to come. We will be coming back :)

I've had more than a few dine-in experiences here as well as take-out. Service has been consistent every single time. The restaurant is always clean and lunch hours get quite busy! As for service I give it an A grade across the board. The food is pretty much the same as other locations. Love their salads such as the Cobb and the Roasted Veggie. Recently I fell in love with the Arugula and Quinoa Salad with Chicken. YUM. As for pasta if I'm feeling a rebellious (from my diet) I will go for the Kung Pao Spaghetti and you just CAN'T pass up the Spinach and Artichoke Dip. Take-out during weekday lunch hours can be a little hectic as everyone crowds at the counter area trying to pick up their order. One time I waited at the counter for 15 minutes trying to pick up 1 salad.... wasn't happy about that! What I give them props for is they are really fast with getting the order ready. Today I ordered about 10 - 12 items for an office party and it was ready in under 20 minutes.
Portions are much smaller and the prices are still high. The food is decent...but for the price I'd rather have something else.

If you aren't from the area and are looking to enjoy a drink with your meal, avoid this place! my girlfriend and I (both age 22) decided to go here after looking for a local place with decent ratings.  After waiting for about 15 minutes with no sign of service, we finally were able to order some Sangria to start the meal. Firstly, the waiter said he needed to check with his manager because both our IDs were out of state (seemed a little unnecessary but we were fine with it). Then the manager comes over, sighs and declares that because we have out of state IDs and they don't have the proper technology, they can't serve us alcohol. She then claimed the only way she could serve us alcohol was if we had our passports (we are both visibly Caucasian and I'm about to turn 23).  Needless to say we left (seeing as neither of us have made it a habit to bring our passports to dinner). I can't comment on the food as I didn't make it that far but if you are from out of state and want to enjoy a beer or two with your meal this isn't the place to so it.

We are visiting from out of state, and were excited to try the pizza here after hearing good things from locals. We were seated quickly, then ignored for 15 minutes. We went to the bar and asked about getting a waiter, and were promptly asked for our orders. We waited another 15-20 minutes, got our appetizer (chips and dip for $4) and THERE WAS A BUG ON TOP OF THE DIP. No service for 15 minutes again. We asked for the manager at this point, and were told they were out for the night and that there was no one for us to speak to. Waiter disappeared too. We walked out without paying, obviously, and will never go back. DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!
Pizza here is small, but also different from typical chains. Just look at the pics to get an idea. They're pretty good too (taste like how they look).

This CPK has the worst service in the world. First off, the hostess was an idiot. And secondly the waitresses and waiters weren't doing their job. Me and my mom had to wait 25 minutes for a table for lunch. And there were plenty of tables available, they just needed to be cleared and cleaned. They really need to hire people who actually are going to do their jobs.

I found a hair in my salad and the prices are too high for the quality of food you get. I can tell that they are more concerned with spending money on marketing and stock holders than providing high-quality food. The place was packed with young families as kids can't tell great food from ordinary.

Decent place to curb your craving for pizza. I like my pizza thin crust a little crispier. I ordered the kung pao pasta after seeing so many reviews on yelp.  I added chicken to my order but was a little disappointed.  Two or three very small pieces of chicken,  just enough to say they did, were added.  I did enjoy the appetizer,  Avocado egg rolls.  They were right out of the oven,  hot and crispy,  a little spicy and the spicy ranch sauce went well with it.
Josh, you're our favorite! When we come in, our drinks are already filled without ordering them. Super friendly, super service, super food... Super Josh :-D
Gluten-free crust does not taste as good as before. Zpizza has better gluten-free crust

Yelp 2014 Challenge 26/100 Pricey pizza, pricey foods! Since Pieology. 800 Degrees Pizza, and Blaze have all sprouted up, they have pretty much replaced the essence of CPK. And the prices of $12+ is something that  I could get for $8 at Blaze/Pieology. But came here yesterday with my friend and ordered the 4 cheese ravioli. Since we love mushrooms, we added $1 for 10 pieces of mushrooms. The taste was there, the flavor nice, and at the right temperature. The vegetarian pizza was a bit too thin for me (and again pricey). Woulda been nice if it were a bit more crispier, but not too shabby. Service was alright, as the waiter came by only once after dropping off the meal. It was kinda awkward at the end because we paid for the check and we left the tip there, but we were unsure whether or not we were able to leave. We waited 5 minutes for someone to come over, but in the end, we asked a busboy if we could leave after paying and he said that it was alright. To the waiter's credit, the restaurant was busy at the time.  Their quality yesterday was better than average, but at that price, I would go elsewhere.

This place used to be good, but once they have expanded so much as a chain not very good anymore. I like the unique pizza toppings very So Cal, but the quality is going downhill. I had a tuna salad one time and the tuna was not sushi quality it was stringy and overcooked. Service is average.

For many years was the choice for pizza in Tustin. Now service is slow, more than often the food comes cold and the fact upper management changed the dough, eliminated real knifes and got cheaper not serving real olives and other items, made Tustin area available for another place for Italian/ American favorite.

Chopped waldorf salad is good same as the works pizza thin crust, Scott( bartender) is really friendly and a great memory, seating at bar is good the see the pizza guys doing the show... Sometimes pizza dough can fly all the way to your seat( not really...)

Both my wife and I have gone to many CPKs in our years here and often order to go and i could say truely and regrettably this is by far the absolute worst service and managed CPK. We usually order to go and so often its incorrect and the management here continues to ignore it. I elevated the last concern after so many bad ones to their management for bettering things potentially and while I did receive a call back I was so terribly disappointed with the response on the several issues I've had; from bad service to mistakes on our order so often. I then asked for a regional manager to call me so I/we can discuss the continuous issues we've had and again to my dismay this time there was no calls. To top it off apparently this is thier training center for development of employees throughout the region. Absolutely amazing how poorly managed this facility is and we've stopped our business after this last time. We're turning to BJ's now regrettably! Best of luck to this business we've tried so much to get fair and accurate service and that's too much to ask apparently!

Unfortunately a little just okay. I ordered the split pea soup and flatbread.  A little bland until I ordered some marinara to dip the flatbread in.  My guy ordered the zucchini pasta with shrimp.  He also was a little disappointed.  More zucchini than anything.  He actually liked my flatbread better.  On the plus side the servers were on top of everything. Our water glasses were constantly filled and they were very nice.  We won't be back, at least he won't be back any time soon.

Wow.. haven't been to CPK for awhile, and the food has really declined. The crust was so chewy and overcooked I could have broken a tooth and not impressed with the taste of my old favorite, Thai Pizza. Service was nice, but I'm OK paying less for better food, even if I have to pick it up at a counter. So sorry to see this pizza innovator fading away.

We live locally and used to frequent this Tustin restaurant 2-3 a month for a good casual dining experience.  Unfortunately, it has deteriorated over the past 18 months. Our last visit was on a Monday in mid-December when we arrived at 5pm for a family celebration - 4 in our party.  Even though the restaurant was not even half full, we had to wait for 10 minutes.  Thereafter our waitress was quite terse and got our orders wrong.  The penne pasta and chicken pasta arrived luke-warm and the sandwich was cold.  When I complained to the manager, he offered an apology but did not seem unduly bothered.  Basically we couldn't wait to get out of there and go somewhere else (anywhere!) for dessert.  Unfortunately, that was easier said than done as it took forever to get our bill.  I eventually went up to pay, something I don't think I've ever done. Worst service, appalling meals and what is with the new positioning of the desk?  You're greeted with the back of the maître d' when you enter - I guess that's indicative of how CPK feels about their customers.

Every time I come to calforina pizza kitchen the food is amazing and drinks are to die for. I leave satisfied and stuffed.  Our server Fernando was the best. He was polite and friendly. I will definitely ask for him next time I come in!
How in the f is this a pizza kitchen when the pizza is this fuggin this small like dafuq nyugahhh!? I aint even full!! Even after my appetizers I was still hungry but other than it was tasty.

Worse CPK in Orange County! I love CPK. I go often to the one in Laguna Hills. But this location is the worse! The worse service, worse employees, and the worse food. They are horribly slow with service. They can't get the orders correct. The waiters don't understand how awful it is to bring out  food for the person you came with but not bring your dinner / lunch until the person you came with is all finished. I hate this location & will never go again. It all went downhill when Erik left!

Just got take out because our son begged us to get their pizza.  I ordered a roasted vegetable sandwich and soup.  The sandwich was all lettuce with one slice of roasted zucchini.  The soup came in a cup and was only 1/3 full.  Needless to say we will not be ordering from here again!!!

Terrible food and okay service. I went there a few months ago and my pizza was hard and dry. I never complain or send my food back but I was still disappointed the following day so I wrote corporate an email. I have yet to receive a response so it goes to show how much they don't care about their customers. I am craving pizza and thought about going to CPK tonight but they clearly don't care about getting business so I will take it else where. A simple apology goes a LONG way.

This is my family's go to restaurant! we live across the street and they are so family friendly... Especially baby friendly! They go above and beyond to make sure baby needs are met... For example- I needed to warm up Breast milk for my baby and they brought out kitchen bowls for me to warm up the bottle with warm water! I love that! Plus they have THE BEST DESSERTS!!!

Tonight my experience with CPK regarding the food was really good. The carnitas pizza was a big surprise and let me tell you something you can ask to have done in thin crust with an extra cost. Worth it. The salsa that goes along with it was excellent. The only minus at this location is the size of the place. Seats are limited and because of that my family of six was placed in a booth with and extra chair  our table way too crowed.

I like California pizza kitchen, but this one is not good at all. Been here a couple of times and every time the food was bland, pasta is undercooked and dry. Two stars because the servers here are nice. This place definitely needs to step up their food quality.

Giving 2 stars because I do like the margarita pizza and bbq chicken. Called to make a reservation I was put on hold BY THE MANAGER 3 times and each time they kept acting like it was a new call are you serious?! Just to tell me no reservations that day, so annoying. So that's strike one, strike two, i don't know if this was a mouthy bar tender or a bar tending manager but she was screaming at multiple servers right infront of our table while my friends and I are trying to enjoy our pizza. Strike 3, I ordered the Cali club pizza which wasn't bad but basically it's a cheese pizza with bacon and chicken with a salad on top. I'm thinking there would be cheese on top of the spinach and avocado, nope just a salad on top of the pizza really weird wouldn't order it again. My friends had the pear gounzola pizza which was weird I didn't like it and my other friend had the Thai pizza which all three were the same concept cheese pizza with salad on top. Won't be back your restaurant gets two thumbs down! Step it up.
I love coming to this CpK location. Atmosphere is great and the food is soo yummy !! Pablo always cooks the best pastas !!!

After visiting some friends near the Tustin Market Place in Tustin we decided to eat here on our way home, since we both were hungry.  My wife has been to the one in Fashion Island and Irvine and was not impressed, but we decided to give this location a try. As soon as we walked in the door there was someone to greet us and another person to seat us. The waiter came immediately after we sat down and greeted us in a friendly manner while handing us our menu's and taking our drink order.  A few minutes passed and warm sourdough bread with an olive oil and pepper dip was placed in front of us. I ordered the mushroom, pepperoni and sausage pizza and my wife ordered the Moroccan chicken salad.  Both entree's were delicious.  I am French Italian and the pizza reminded me of being in Italy.  The 1/2 order salad and pizza were perfect to split between the both of us.  The place was clean and the decor was classy.  We loved it!

Our family ordered 4 pizzas and requested full salad to come out early so we could enjoy prior to the pizza.  Salad never arrived until AFTER the pizza.  The waitress did comp us the salad.  Why the 1 star?   We saved one pizza to take home for later.  I asked for a box but the waitress took it and boxed it up for us.  I never looked.  When we got home, we no longer had a whole, fresh pizza but two different kinds of leftover, half eaten pizza from some other table!!!  I immediately called the restaurant and was assured by the manager that she would credit our credit card and she would call me either that night or the next day to confirm.  Have never heard from her and of course, have never received a credit.  Horrible customer service and absolutely disgusting to be given some strangers leftovers and "lose" a whole pizza!!!  Will not return to this location!

I called in a take-out order and they told me the exact time I could pick it up (down to the minute). It was being bagged just as I got there.  When you've got maniacal little kids, the less time you spend standing around waiting, the better.  The food was good. I liked the white pizza and Chinese chicken salad.
The gluten free crust was gross. The waiter was nice but for half the price I'm going across the street to Pieology where the pies are good!!!!
The service was great and we can always rely on the food quality.  I particularly love their Waldorf salad and chicken piccata yum!

CPK has great salads. Anytime I feel like getting something decently healthy, this is where I come. Only negative is it's hard to take out  because I always feel like the salad greens turn brown quickly.  The bread with their garlic oil mix is always great to have. When I feel like splurging for desserts I definitely love their butter cake and chocolate soufflé cake with ice cream! Overall it's a good chain restaurant.
Great food and great service, I love the wedge salad and the Jamaican Jerk Pizza.  This location kind of sucks because of the parking but it's still a yummy place to eat.

jaqui, how can I even start with her. though her love, patience, understanding support and guide I don't know where I would be. she has helped me in a way I never thought was possible. ive seen plently of therapist but none like jaqui. he work is literally magic. never will I foget the things she has taught me.

My husband and I came here on a Saturday night around 5:30pm.  We were seated immediately in a booth right next to the hostess station and front door.  My husband didn't like this booth.   It took awhile to be greeted by our server, even though it wasn't busy.  We ordered a beer and summer drink, the strawberry mojito (beware it's over $8.00 for 75% ice and very little drink).  We were offered bread while we waited for our entrees. We ordered the Kung pao spaghetti and a chicken and arugula dish.  The bread never came out and we had to ask for it again.  The kung pao spaghetti was ok but OVERPRICED.  For $11+, you get spaghetti with some sweet sauce and green onions & peanuts.  You have to pay extra for chicken or shrimp.  Rip off.  I can make this at home for $2.00.   My husbands dish was fine,  strange because it was arugula on top of chicken breasts.  My husband is a trained chef and this isn't normal.  I'm not sure if we'll return considering all the other options around.  Seriously, CPK has gone down in value, quality and service in the last few years.

This place used to be good when they first came out.  Now they are so chintzy with their ingredients.  My husband ordered The chopped salad and there was hardly any salami or turkey in the salad.  It was full of lettuce.  My Chili Relleno was cold and the amount served was not filling.  The selections on the menu are very poor. It is unfortunate that this place is not what it used to be.

They get my special request for my To go Garlic Cream Fettucine every time. I'm very picky with ingredients but they always deliver it too me perfectly.  Courteous pick up counter rep, very respectful and caring. This was yesterday 05.12 at 6pm.  I love this Tustin Marketplace branch.  Keep it up.

To start off with, one of the biggest pet peeves I have with restaurants is when the appetizers are brought out and then the food comes out right after it.  To avoid this problem, I usually stagger the order because chain restaurants like CPK tend to "Cattle" you in and out and they really don't care about the dining experience.  Nobody wants a table full of food all run out at the same time.   Case in point:  My wife and I dined here Sunday 8/7/15 at approximately 6PM and had no problems getting a table since it was pretty quiet which was surprising for a Sunday dining time.  We sat in the furthest corner booth and our waiter was Philip.  Philip was nice and engaging.  We ordered the Hummus and a Caesar Salad to split.  We put the order in and then waiting another 10 minutes to order our entree's which were the Jambalaya and Zucchini Fettuccini.  They were run out by a food runner a little late but it wasn't too bad. We made it through about half of our appetizers when another food runner brought out our entree's.  This is a clear operations problem because Philip was nowhere to be seen throughout our meal except to let me know he would bring me another water which, by the way never came until the end of the meal followed by 4-5 apologies.  There was no problem getting the check quickly though.  I would assume that this happened because they needed the table.  The main problem here is a complete lack of communication between the server, the kitchen and the runners.  We essentially had to make a choice of finishing our appetizers and letting our food get cold or opt into our main course and leave the rest of the appetizers.  We opted for the latter alternative which resulted in us wasting about 50% of our appetizers.     The competition for dining in this corridor is becoming very intense with several new restaurants planned like Taps, Daves BBQ and Wokcano plus the new Mizu Sushi Bar and Grill already in place.  Establishments like CPK need to up their game if they are going to compete and operational excellence is probably the easiest thing to accomplish if they put some time into it.  Again, this place was nowhere near capacity so this should not have happened.  The Irvine Companies seem to have no problem with removing stores that don't fit the profile they are trying to achieve here and several chains have been essentially told to seek business elsewhere like On The Border and Buca Di Beppo.

I had an amazing experience at CPK, in Tustin Market Place. I'm talking one of those 'wow' service experiences that are so on point that I wanted to stay there all night. My wife and I went to dinner there last night and we went right in the thick of a Friday night dinner rush. The wait was about 20 minutes, which wasn't too bad considering how busy it was. We were sat at the same time as party of 9 (5 of which were young children) right by us. Not a big deal, but just to put a bit of perspective on the situation, we had the same server as that party.    Then our server, Phillip, walked up. He was fun, witty, professional, had a sense of urgency - if I owned a restaurant I would want an entire staff of him. He was able to suggest good drinks, walk us through the appetizers without being pushy or trying to sell us on anything and just made the dining experience better than most. His timing was on point; his table presence was warm and fun. He made quite the positive first impression.  To reiterate, California Pizza Kitchen, being a corporate chain, has the same food at every location - which is good food. The reason for the 5 star review is because of our server Phillip and his amazing customer service and table side presence. If you're lucky enough to be sat in his section, you'll have a great experience. Thanks Phillip!
My salon has been using CPK for years for our dinner meetings. The food is always fresh and they always have something new. The manager Sam is always so helpful and greets us with a friendly smile.

I've been going to CPKs for so long I think I'm getting a little bored of the pizza.  Having said that, at least its consistently decent.  The two times I've been to this location, I've gotten better than average service, which is to say, very good.  Really nothing to complain about, but also tough to say much.  It's a chain, and well managed.

So hubby and I have been to California Pizza several times this the first time we have been at the Tustin location. We ordered an appetizer - the artichoke dip. For our main course we ordered the Pear and Gorgonzola Pizza (our favorite).  As usual the pizza was delicious. My only discrepancy was that the appetizer came out with our main course. Subsequently, I ask the waiter didn't see our waitress until the end) to return the appetizer and let him know we no longer desired the appetizer. One minutes later the manager came and apologized and informed us he will "take care" of the appetizer and inquired if we would like anything else and he would gladly box our appetizer for us. . We declined and continued dining. When we received our check (the 2nd and final time the waitress waited on us) we were pleased to see we were not charged for the appetizer. Despite having an innatentive waitress we were very pleased with the regard for the customer (via management). Thank you for keeping it classy California Pizza Kitchen!

I'm giving this 5-stars because it's probably "as good as it gets" in this category (casual/family dining).  I've eaten here a few times, sat at the bar and dined at tables and each time the service was friendly and polite and food is always consistent.  Even better is one time i was sitting at the bar alone and the pizza chefs were interacting and talking to me.  Cool guys.  They seemed to enjoy their job.  Only downside is there is no happy hour (but i guess they don't need it).  I've had some bad or lackluster experiences at other CPKs but never at this one.  If i'm in the neighborhood and hungry, I will definitely come by.

So overall the service was ok. Our server was a little slow and not very attentive. The food tasted good and came out pretty fast. For the amount of employees here there seems to be a lack of efficiency.

Thanks CPK for supporting Habitat for Humanity!  My friend and I met up there for drinks and dinner only because they had a special fundraiser going on for Habitat for Humanity. We arrived early so we were able to get seated immediately without a wait.  I went there with the best intentions to order off of their "Lite Adventures" menu but was lured into high calorie land with one of their special summer drinks...the strawberry lime margarita.  It was extra tasty on such a hot day. We then decided to share the waldorf salad and roasted artichoke & spinach pizza.  I wasn't a fan of the pizza but the salad which included grapes, green apples, candied walnuts, celery, field greens, gorgonzola and topped with a dijon balsamic dressing was very flavorful. While the salad and drink was pretty good, the service was a little slow and the restaurant was on the warm side (although it was pretty hot outside). I'll definitely be back in the future to try out the Lite Adventures menu and will hope for a cooler restaurant and faster service.
We had a great time. The service was good,  we always love the food here at CPK.  I ordered the salmon and it came out great.

I don't see what all the fuss is with this restaurant. I'm originally from NY, so I am definitely picky about my pizza. Pizza in the O.C. tends to be bready, garlicy which pretty much overtakes the flavor of a good pizza. OC'ers love their garlic, personally I think there is a time and place for garlic. I found the cheese to be bland (yes, even 3 blended cheese), and the entire pizza was ruined by that ever familiar garlic taste. The Tiramisu also left a lot to be desired, very diluted and pretty much "melted" by the time I got home. The cranberry "cooler" I ordered was way watered down and had no fizz practically at all. The ONLY thing saving this meal was the staff was friendly and pleasant, all three people I interacted with, despite the fact I went on a busy Friday evening, I just wish the food was better. Never again. I think I liked their frozen pizza better!. Sorry folks, but I call them as I sees them!

I have been to CPK several times over the years. Its a spot that my mom really likes so I am usually with her. What you will find at every location: Cpk has clean and cute interior. The staff is usually friendly and the atmosphere is good for a casual date.  The Pizza: They are big enough to split. The crust ia crispy and thin. I have tried several kinds and every one is really good. This location: On par with all past experiences. Service was attentive amd fast. We were served right away and our waiter was  very friendly. What I tried: I tried the Vegetable Chile Relleno and it was REALLY tasty. I was surprised. Normally I am not too impressed with fusion but this was quite good.  Overall: This is a good stand by. Never my first choice, but if it is near by I know it will please the crowd.

Ordered a gluten-free BBQ chicken pizza with bacon and pineapple. We substituted the cheese for goat cheese on half (food allergies ). Wound up with (still good) chickenless pizza...Sam, the manager, handled it well and took it off the check. He didn't want us paying for something that didn't come out how we ordered it. Kris, our server, was nice too.   Good food, good place and parking, good management. I recommend this CPK!

If it's working, don't fix it. Ordered a basic angel hair pomodoro that had no flavor!! Kids were craving some CPK Mac and cheese, which also came our unsatisfactory. Just because you think you need to mix it up a bit...doesn't mean you have to change a classic. Hope the new location on Alton gets it right!

Hostess need training cuz they seem a bit clueless. They also don't seem to communicate well...15 min wait turned into a 45 min wait and they kept telling us it was almost ready and then it wasn't almost ready... Blah blah blah. n e ways. maybe their new, idk.     Food was great artichoke dip the Jamaican jerk pizza everyone was satisfied but we seemed to keep getting a little forgotten. He was really sweet tho . N e who service all around out of five I'd give it a 1 and the food was good so 2more.  Yay.

My visit to CPK was ok. They were very busy, but we sat ourselves at the bar/counter area. Our server was Scott. He got drinks out fast and refilled without us having to ask! Great service from him. Strawberry lemonade was great! I got the Cesar salad half size for 6.99. I would say it looked more like a $5 salad. Nothing special. For appetizer we got the chips and guacamole. We expected a large portion of chips but there were not that many chips on plate. Guac had corn in it; it seemed like filler to me.  Next time I will try the pizza here. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing

Oh man, this place has completely redesigned their restaurant to put a modern rustic twist to fine and yet affordable dining. Food selections have changed since i'd been back (approx 2 years ago), Flavorful with their food as always. Their wedge salad is very well made in which the bleu cheese has been incorporated into the ranch style dressing, giving it an even spread throughout the salad. If you enjoy chicken, they have a new rotisserie chicken that they've added to their menu. Definitely a family atmosphere with great attitudes from waiters that never neglect you one bit. Enjoy your visit if you happen to sit for a meal.  Cheers!

Just got home and ate my pickup order. What was supposed to be a BBQ chicken pizza was more like a BBQ sauce pizza. I asked to go guy to put in some Parmesan cheese, butter for the bread and some plastic utensils. Nope, none in the bag. Hardly any chicken or onions. I then went to eat my half Italian chopped salad that was supposed to have tomatoes, salami,  turkey and mozzarella cheese. Again, you needed a magnify glass to see any. Stupid me for trusting them and not checking my order before I left. If I would've , I would have said, "No thanks" and walked out the door. I will not be back to any CPK. It should stand for Corporate Pizza Killers cause everything was so very very bad.

They have completely changed their menu and decor!! Yum!!! We decided to go see what changes were made for lunch and were very pleasantly surprised! Mushroom spinach pizza was excellent! Crusty French bread with olive oil dipping sauce was a tasty complimentary starter. We got the lunch special pizza and split pea soup. Soup was pretty good. Pizza was excellent! My guest liked the harvest soup! We will go back!

Food: always consistient so you know what to expect. Take out: normally I order take out on line, today I ordered via phone.  I was unaware CPK uses off site reps for this task, not only was the rep unfamiliar with the menu and options, but also lacked basic computer entry skills to input a 3 item order demonstrated by the 66% accuracy on the order.  I would simply suggest implementing some product knowledge training in this regard to minimize the error rate.

been coming to this place for a super long time and still cannot get over their Mac n cheese and bbq chicken pizza!  recently called in and ordered food to go for the first time and Megan (short and curly hair) was so sweet! she double checked my order and recommended another pizza which was amazing. 5 stars for this location and the to go girl megan

I have to say since they got new management this place is a great place to go for lunch or dinner. Food is consistently Good. The staff is friendly and professional. Really go out of their way to ensure you are satisfied.
Great service! Their manager Chris is extremely friendly, and very kind, all the servers are also fantastic.

Love CPK Garlic Cream Fettuccini with Chicken. Visit this location several times a year, and it is always good. Seems they updated interior decor since my last visit, VERY nice with great photo artwork.  Service is good, even during busy lunch hour. All in all, a great local place to meet friends and enjoy good food.
Just checked out, Amber had outstanding customer service. We had an artichoke chicken/bacon pizza with agave mojitos. On point on service and food.

I believe the name of our server is Kellen! he expressed that he was fairly new to CPK and I was in shock. Kellen is an outstanding server always kind and attentive. He kept our spirits up with jokes while we were waiting for the rest of our party to arrive and he was super bright and fast.  We didn't even have to request another plate of bread, he just kept it coming thankfully haha. Thank you CPK and Kellen for an amazing lunch experience

They have remodeled and prices have gone up!  The food was good though.  I got the cedar plank with the corn succotash.  Salmon was good but a little bland.  I added salt.  The corn succotash was delicious!!  Loved it!!  It was $18.99.  . Not sure it was worth that but good meal!   My friend got the chicken piccata & it was good.  She did add some salt to her dish as well so not sure if it was us or just a little light tonight on the flavor.   Service was decent.  Good food but a little pricey.
Newly renovated decor and menu Our waitress was super nice  - very attentive.  Love everything.  Definitely will be returning

This is one of the most delicious CPKs I've ever been to. The bread spot on. Fantastic customer service, The waiter recommended I try something new, he told me if I didn't like it he would bring me anything else I wanted. I had the thai spaghetti it was amazing and something I definitely wouldn't of tried without the suggestion.  When I don't feel like going in I just ordered curbside to go.

Better than the last time I came.  I ordered half a caesar salad and the ham and cheese flatbread.  The salad was good as usual.  I really like the shaved parm on it.  Could have use a few more croutons.  I think there was a total of four on the whole salad.  (And when each of your kids takes one, that only leaves two!)  My flatbread came out hot, yet the crust was a little soggy because it is so thin.  Maybe a little too thin.  But the toppings were good - caramelized onions are great on any pizza!  It was a new item; hope they keep it around.  The flatbreads are the perfect size if you have half a salad.  Service was good.  Now they offer shredded parm for your meal instead of the powdered cheese shaker on the table.  Free refills on milk for the kids is a nice bonus.  Overall, it's decent for a chain, though I feel like the prices are higher than before.  I'd give it a 3.5 if there were half stars.

My fiancé and I had a great experience when we went last week. Vlad (our server) was very helpful and helped us choose food and drinks from the bar. Chris (the Manager) was SUPER helpful as well. He was very friendly and it was apparent that he truly loves his job. It is great to see that a manager be this helpful and respectful to his employees. (What a great leader!) We WILL be returning to this CPK in particular, because of the great customer service. Oh, and of course, the food that was recommended by Chris and Vlad was delicious! :)  By the way, we ordered the Avocado Egg Rolls, White Corn Guacamole, BBQ Chicken Pizza, and cup of the Sedona Tortilla Soup. Everything was delicious!
Great service, wonderful scenery, and great food. Can never go wrong with the bbq pizza. Our waiter, Philip made our evening. If you looking for a cheap yet wonderful restaurant this is your place.

I took my family to CPK in Santa Ana Sunday night, it was very busy so we sat in the patio, the server took forever to bring our drinks, the pizzas were OK..and the service was awful!!, not sure that we will be back..

Had a lunch with a customer and distributor. Was a great pizza. Had the buffalo chicken pizza and wow it was great.  When we arrived we were greeted by a very personable, happy gal and she immediately sat us. All 5 of us had pizza and there were no complaints at all.  Will defiantly be going back when I return to the area.

went in for some dinner and had great service. The server Mayan was incredible and very helpful.. also Alyssa the manager made sure our visit was awesome.. Definitely will be coming back! Best cpk in my opinion.
One of the best experiences ever. Server, Phil was on point, refills, service an amazing visit from start to finish. Made sure we had a great meal and night. Thank you Phil for a great time.
Love this restaurant! The food is amazing the service is great I'll recommend to try the new steak that they have. I love their new design and the new menu

I personally would never come to CPK, but my little sister wanted to go so I went with my family. First of all, the waiter brought out only 4 small plates when we had 5 people. Next, he forgot about our wine. Also, when we asked if the California Club pizza was tomato based he said yes, but it wasn't. We ordered the penne, mushroom, and bolognese pastas and the noodles were cooked well but they tasted average and bland. The California Club pizza tasted like I was eating a sandwich. At the end of the meal there was an extra glass of wine added to our bill that we didn't even order because we ordered a bottle. Definitely did not appreciate that. Overall this is somewhere I would never come back based on customer service and quality of food. If you do decide to go here, download their app to get a free small bites plate.

They have remodeled this restaurant and love the new reclaimed look. It was our daughter's birthday and this was her request for her birthday lunch. Our kids love their curly Mac n cheese. I love their Chinese Chicken salad...always consistent. My hubby ordered their ribeye medium well but the order came out looking more like well done. The manager, Chris, remedied it quickly and replaced it with a new one, including sides and all. We were not expecting a great service as this from CPK but we did get one. I guess we should listen to our kids...they know their restaurants!  Our server, Selene, was great as well. Kudos to you guys, Chris and Selene! Thank you for making our little girl's lunch extra special!

californians seem deathly afraid of carbs (myself included) so i opted for the thin crust pepperoni and mushroom.  which is my favorite pizza here.  i always wonder who picks the favorites on the cpk menu or any menu for that matter.  i certainly would have voted for cpk's classic pepperoni.  their pepperoni is top notch.  it's got a hint of spice which i like.  keep in mind that there's an up-charge for thin crust.  less crust more money - go figure but it was worth it.    in the same visit i tried the spicy chipotle chicken.  i'm not sure what i was expecting but the toppings just didn't mesh well - bell peppers, black beans, almost nonexistent chicken.  i guess in theory it should work but it didn't.  the sauce that accompanied made it slightly better. i will not be having this pizza again.  there's a reason why this one is not a cpk favorite.  the interior got a major facelift.  it looks different but it doesn't add to the whole cpk experience.
Delicious food , fresh and simple great flavors and the service was great seat at the bar with Scott best bartender ever!! Love the pizza with egg....and the pudding for dessert.
The food are pretty nice and the prices are alright. The service is excellent.
My family loves this place. We really love the new menu and layout. Great salads and pizza.

I'm only giving this place one star due to the hostesses here. I went in to get my to go order and it was my first time getting it to go so I went up to where the hostesses were and while I went up they were having a full blown convo and even while I was standing and staring at them to acknowledge me. Then the blonde girl said oh you have to go over there rudely. I can not stand when people do not take their job seriously like why are you working there. To go people were super nice but I wish I got those girls name but I just know it was a blonde and a brunette.
Draft beer has even gotten better. 2 IPAs Nice!!! No better place than good food, good beer and good sports on the tube!

So many issues with this location of CPK it's hard to know where to begin.   On a previous visit, my party and I were served lunch on not-yet-cleaned plates with food from the previous guests still on both the top and bottom of the plate.  Bypassing the health department issues altogether - the yuk factor was exceedingly high.   A number of months have passed and a co-worker asked to meet me at this location.  OK - the service was improved.  My waiter was pleasant, helpful and friendly - and, the plates were clean.  But, the food was not at all good.  I ordered the Chicken Piccata.   The chicken was so over cooked it would not cut - it separated in shards.  No time to reorder so for the second of two (and, for different reasons) I was served food I could not eat / enjoy.  There are many other food choices in this area - do yourself a favor and pick one.

I really don't know why we keep trying this chain. Have yet to have a positive experience and this is 3 for 3. Started at the one in Santa Ana, then the one at the Spectrum now this one is strike 3. This time wait times were dramatically under estimated, by rude receptionists. Then when we were seated we had to wait 6 minutes before anyone approached our table.   The food arrived fine as was ok. However the whole experience was already ruined.

We've been sitting more than an hour after ordering & still don't have our food. The server explained how the ticket was lost, as if was a common occurrence. Epic fail, especially with the manager not taking any ownership until just now. And on Mother's Day...

What happened to CPK?? I decided to treat myself by taking home my favorite Tostada Pizza the other day... The crust was burned to a thin crisp, there weren't enough beans and cheese to cover it and there were hardly any mini tortilla strips, my favorite part besides the ranch dressing (there's never enough of that but I forgot to order extra). So I supplemented with my own ranch but I couldn't hack it... It was like eating cardboard. I threw it away, along with about $20. Never again.

California Pizza Kitchen has recently modified their menu. The staff is always friendly and helpful, the interior always immaculate.  This California Pizza Kitchen is superior to the one in Brea, the food quality and service is much better at this location. The food is always quality, they never get the order wrong. The take out service here is impeccable, and if you're dining in, they certainly do not disappoint. Family friendly, I feel right at home dining here. Children will love the dishes that are offered here. This has got to be one of my daughter's favorite spots to dine at. My only quarrel is that they have recently modified their chocolate souffle, it isn't as good as before. I'm a vegetarian, I would suggest the Cremlini pasta, or the Fields Salad, excellent portion sizes, and the quality of food is excellent. Curbside service makes ordering and take out swift and easy. Be sure to check their website for Online Ordering and to sign up for the Pizza Dough Rewards System. Get your pizza on! California Style! Located conveniently in The Market Place, near the Petsmart and Wokcano.

It was my second time at this location. First time, it was about 2 years ago, it took  too long to get our order, they made a mistake, tried to make it up.. Wasn't a good first time experience.  Second time it was as low as first time, but at least we got the food we ordered. I don't think I'll be going this location ever again

Fresh food-attentive service- decent price. We went to CPK for lunch. The restaurant was clean. We were seated right away with pleasant smiles. The waitress came right up to us and took our drink orders. After the drinks were delivered we ordered one cobb salad, one BBQ chicken chopped salad, and one kids pepperoni pizza. The 1/2 salads were $12 and the pizza was $6. The ingredients were fresh and tasty. Drinks were constantly refilled. Good experience. We left happy.

I don't what happened to this place, but from the second you walk in the door, the service is absolutely terrible. The young woman at the front station was obviously inexperienced, but that wasn't all; she was also snotty and rude. This kind of behavior is thoroughly unacceptable in any service position, but it seems to be the norm among workers in their 20"s who, more often than not, are spoiled and clueless in the ways of providing quality customer service. The indignities didn't stop there though.  Once we were finally given a table, the waiter was hopeless and couldn't get our drink order straight or correct - I had to repeat the order multiple times and slowly and specifically point exactly what we wanted - and he still couldn't get it right.  When it came to time to place our food order, the waiter, at first, was inappropriately preoccupied with other patrons - people who came in after we did - and, like our drink order, forgot items that we ordered.  We remained patient, but, frankly this type of service is unacceptable, even in a chain restaurant. I don't expect a Michelin 3 star restaurant when going to a CPK, but I DO expect basic civility, courtesy and competence from the staff. None of that was in existence when we came here and we won't be going back.
Michael N was such an amazing waiter. So polite & the service was fast . He is a very hard worker. Thank you for treating us so well.

CPK is always a good place to get a good pizza with out a doubt, the drinks are ice cold and the severs are friendly, but the appetizer plates are small portions. Other than that no complaints oh and the dour dough bread is so good with the herbs and olive oil! But be careful it's addicting and filling!

I am from Tustin and grew up going to this location, so recently when I walked in and saw a totally different restaurant inside- I was very delighted.  They got a MAJOR and much needed refresh, the food is still on point and the menu has stayed classic.  I do not like the location the of host station and the fact that they have 1 bench that sits three people for a waiting area; this could have been a much better use of space if someone took the time to think it through.  I like sitting at the bar, you can see all the food prepared and it's a cool vibe.

We ordered 12 box lunches delivered for a corporate meeting in the area and it goes without saying that the food was on point- CPK always is!  The service at this location is what took it over-and-above.  There was a credit card system glitch that day and my company card was accidentally overcharged.  These things happen, but the way they are handled when they do is what gives businesses opportunity to exceed expectations.  A Manager named Christopher was so diligent, owning the situation and called me each day until it was corrected.  He made sure I had the information I needed to settle my expenses- and FAST!  Once it was all resolved, he even sent a thank you note along with a couple of vouchers which I am 100% certain we will use and enjoy for another meeting in the near future!

Made reservations for a party of 10 ahead of time.  When I got there it was all ready for me, even though they were b-u-s-y!   I had some stragglers come and join the party and the staff managed to put some tables together so we could all sit together.  Very polite, efficient and professional staff.  Our server was Phil and he was phenomenal.  Besides our large group, he had several tables on the other side of the restaurant as well but he was as cool and friendly as can be.  Phil - you rock.   Everyone in our group was impressed with the service, the quality of the food and the price.   We'll be back.

This is a review of my curbside order.  Placing the order was easy peasy. Just select your location online, order, and pay. I selected 1:15 as my pickup time. Got there earlier at 1:00 and called to let them know I was there.  My order was ready so it was brought out in a couple of minutes. I was able to add a soda last minute, so that was convenient!  However, I was in a hurry and didn't notice that they left out my complimentary bread and utensils (which is an added option online) until I got back to work. Also, pizza was almost rock hard and can only imagine how far in advance my order was cooked.  I called to provide my feedback and the worker asked me "so what do you want me to do about it?" Uhhhhh transfer me to the manager girl.  Manager was really nice and offered a 20% off discount, which was nice. But I won't be coming back. I'd rather eat CPK when I have the time to dine in. Curbside food quality is NOT on par with their usual dine in food. And service isn't that great.

As Yelp! puts it.... "Meh, I've experienced better". We came in with the intent of just having some drinks at the bar (and possibly apps/dessert), since we had already had dinner earlier in the evening.  We went to sit at the bar... there were plenty of empty seats, but the entire bar was covered in dirty dishes from the previous guests. It was made apparent that they had no intention of cleaning the bar so that we could sit there. The bartender (Scott) said, "My manager is going to clean that table off for you over there". A couple minutes later, he repeats, "My manager cleaned off that table for you..." and then points to the table. This would have been a perfect opportunity for Scott or the manager to come to us and say, "I'll show you to your table". It would have been a lot more professional than what was essentially, "hey... go sit over there." After that... the service was average... there was nothing notable about it either in a positive or negative light. I did notice that even after we sat down at the table, the bar counter remained uncleared for a good 15-20 minutes.  Would prefer to not come back to this location.
